## Description {#details}

Drive the analysis of interleaved memory accesses in the loop.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> this class to analyze interleaved accesses only when we can vectorize a loop. Otherwise it&#39;s meaningless to do analysis as the vectorization on interleaved accesses is unsafe.

The analysis collects interleave groups and records the relationships between the member and the group in a map.

Definition at line 630 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h">VectorUtils.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### analyzeInterleaving() {#af587d7218fa15a456103c3d2125a1fc8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void InterleavedAccessInfo::analyzeInterleaving (bool EnableMaskedInterleavedGroup)">
Analyze the interleaved accesses and collect them in interleave groups.

Substitute symbolic strides using <code>Strides</code>. Consider also predicated loads/stores in the analysis if <code>EnableMaskedInterleavedGroup</code> is true.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h/#l00643">643</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h">VectorUtils.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/vectorutils-cpp/#l01303">1303</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/vectorutils-cpp">VectorUtils.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### invalidateGroups() {#a9d9b6620a692f452f5080cb0c20e41e3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::InterleavedAccessInfo::invalidateGroups ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Invalidate groups, e.g., in case all blocks in loop will be predicated contrary to original assumption.

Although we currently prevent group formation for predicated accesses, we may be able to relax this limitation in the future once we handle more complicated blocks. Returns true if any groups were invalidated.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h/#l00650">650</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h">VectorUtils.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### invalidateGroupsRequiringScalarEpilogue() {#afad01409b57e77467d7cafa03ffe3d3f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void InterleavedAccessInfo::invalidateGroupsRequiringScalarEpilogue ()">
Invalidate groups that require a scalar epilogue (due to gaps).

This can happen when optimizing for size forbids a scalar epilogue, and the gap cannot be filtered by masking the load/store.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h/#l00691">691</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h">VectorUtils.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/vectorutils-cpp/#l01606">1606</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/vectorutils-cpp">VectorUtils.cpp</a>.

### canReorderMemAccessesForInterleavedGroups() {#a316b31ae4ba73371a530ebeb27320d1e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::InterleavedAccessInfo::canReorderMemAccessesForInterleavedGroups (StrideEntry &#42; A, StrideEntry &#42; B) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns true if memory accesses <code>A</code> and <code>B</code> can be reordered, if necessary, when constructing interleaved groups.

<code>A</code> must precede <code>B</code> in program order. We return false if reordering is not necessary or is prevented because <code>A</code> and <code>B</code> may be dependent.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h/#l00798">798</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h">VectorUtils.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### collectDependences() {#aee49da5c2001a7914482802f2a466f15}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::InterleavedAccessInfo::collectDependences ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Collect the dependences from <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopaccessinfo">LoopAccessInfo</a>.

We process the dependences once during the interleaved access analysis to enable constant-time dependence queries.

### PSE {#ab20bd3c889d45067d7e71c9d64782bbf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>PredicatedScalarEvolution&amp; llvm::InterleavedAccessInfo::PSE</>}>
A wrapper around <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a>, used to add runtime <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> checks.

Simplifies <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expressions in the context of existing <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> assumptions. The interleaved access analysis can also add new predicates (for example by versioning strides of pointers).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h/#l00701">701</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h">VectorUtils.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RequiresScalarEpilogue {#a4eba7f1755d63c3de0671131f0349ea0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::InterleavedAccessInfo::RequiresScalarEpilogue = false">
True if the loop may contain non-reversed interleaved groups with out-of-bounds accesses.

We ensure we don&#39;t speculatively access memory out-of-bounds by executing at least one scalar epilogue iteration.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h/#l00711">711</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/vectorutils-h">VectorUtils.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
